descript.abstract: This map layer shows street centerlines in central Ohio. Specifically, this layer covers Franklin County and a seven-mile radius beyond. This layer was created by the Mid-Ohio Regional Planning Commission (MORPC) as part of the Location Based Response System (LBRS) initiative of the Ohio Geographically Referenced Information Program (OGRIP). This layer is cooperatively maintained by various entities in the region including MORPC, Columbus, Dublin, Worthington, Westerville, Gahanna, Grove City, Hilliard, and Franklin County.
descript.purpose: This map layer shows street centerlines in central Ohio.

idinfo.useconst: This data is dedicated to the public domain under the Creative Commons Universal License (CC0).

idinfo.datacred: Mid-Ohio Regional Planning Commission, City of Columbus, Franklin County, City of Dublin, City of Worthington, City of Westerville, City of Gahanna, Grove City, City of Hilliard
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Unique segment ID within a county
A unique identifier across counties
Primary street prefix
Primary street prefix
The primary street type. Example: ALY, AVE, BLVD, DR, LN, PKWY, RD, PL, ST, CIR
The primary street directional suffix. Example: N, S, E, W, NW, NE, SW, SE
Potential address range left side at the segment's start node
Potential address range left side at the segment's end node
Potential address range right side at the segment's start node
Potential address range right side at the segment's end node
The Township name on the left side of the street segment
The township name on the right side of the street segment
The municipality name on the left side of the street segment
The municipality name on the right side of the street segment
The 3 character county code on the left side of the street segment
The 3 character county code on the right side of the street segment
The state name abbreviation on the left side of the street segment. Example: OH, MI, IN
The state name abbreviation on the right side of the street segment. Example: OH, MI, IN
The ZIP Code on the left side of the street segment
The ZIP Code on the right side of the street segment
Left side FIPS code (County, Municipal or Township)
Right side FIPS code (County, Municipal or Township)
ODOT jurisdictional code. This is an ODOT code and does not indicate ownership or maintainance.
County in which the segment is located
ODOT route code. This is an ODOT code and does not indicate ownership or maintainance.
ODOT road number
ODOT route extension
ODOT route description
Indicated as C for cardinal N for non-cardinal

Calculated Network Linear Feature Identifier. This value uniquely identifies a route within a county. It is a 14-character field based on a composition of jurisdiction, county, route system, route number, route number extension, route description, and cardinal direction.
3D Traversed distance from beginning point of route in miles
3D Traversed distance of route from BEG_LOG in miles
3D Traversed distance of segment BEG_LOG to END_LOG in miles
Length of the segment in feet
Surface Type, P=Paved, U=Unpaved
Direction of roadway
A value of TRUE indicates direction of ascending log points does not follow direction of geometry
Divided Road; Y = yes, the section is a dual carriageway or; N = no, the section is a single carriageway only
The number of travel lanes across the street segment
The posted speed limit

edom.edomvd: Driveway, usually privately owned and unnamed
Primary road with limited access or interstate hwy, unseparated
Primary road with limited access or interstate hwy, separated
Primary Highways without limited access, major category
Primary Highways without limited access, unseparated
Primary Highways without limited access, separated
Secondary state and county highway, major category
Secondary state and county highway, unseparated
Secondary state and county highway, separated
Local, neighborhood, rural road, city street, major category
Local, neighborhood, rural road, city street, unseparated
Local, neighborhood, rural road, city street, unseparated in tunnel
Local, neighborhood, rural road, city street, separated
At-grade ramp or connecting road not associated with a limited access highway
Cul-de-Sac, the closed end of a road that forms a loop or turn around
Traffic Circle, the portion of a road or intersection of roads forming a roundabout
Access Ramp, the portion of a road that forms a cloverleaf or limited access interchange
Service Road, provides access to businesses and rest areas
Alley, road for service vehicles, located at the rear of buildings

attr.attrdef: Segement ID used by the COMBAT system.
Segment ID used internally by the City of Columbus
Entity responsible for maintaining the segment in the GIS database
The date of the most recent edit/update to the segment in the database
Entity to last update the segment in the GIS database
Categories for use in map display
Priority of the street segment for snow/ice treatment (Priority 1, 2, or 3)
Identifies the traffic investigator responsible for the segment (NORTHEAST, NORTHWEST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTHWEST)
Code describing the symbology used to display the snow removal responsibility for the segment
Description for the snow removal responsibility for the segment
Department of Public Service maintenance outpost responsible for the segment (Roberts Road, 25th Ave, Marion, Central, or North)
Department of Public Service street maintenance zone
Describes the entity responsible for snow/ice treatment based on agreements between various jurisdictions
Route identifier snow/ice pre-treatment
ID used to dissolve short adjacent segments along snow/ice routes to improve display in Warrior Watch, the Columbus snow plow tracking application
Route identifier snow/ice treatment
Identifies segments that cannot be treated for snow/ice with sand due to combined sewer system
